intro: Gaudichaudia albida var. typica, commonly known as the white-flowered gaudichaudia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
